11
12 VideoOutputFrame::VideoOutputFrame(IDeckLinkMutableVideoFrame *raw_output_frame)
13 : VideoFrame(static_cast<IDeckLinkVideoFrame *>(raw_output_frame))
14 , _raw_output_frame(raw_output_frame)
15 {
16 // Do nothing - Specifically we shouldn't call AddRef since we should be the only
17 // owner of the pointer
18 }
19
20 VideoOutputFrame::~VideoOutputFrame() {
21 _raw_output_frame->Release();
22 }
23
24
25 VideoOutputFrame& VideoOutputFrame::load(const std::vector<unsigned char>& data) {
26 if (data.empty()) BOOST_THROW_EXCEPTION(empty_image_error());
27
28 const auto data_size = data.size() * sizeof(data[0]);
29 if (data_size != size())
30 BOOST_THROW_EXCEPTION(size_error()
31 << errmsg("VideoOutputFrame buffer and provided buffer sizes do not match")
32 << actual_size(data_size)
33 << expected_size(size())
34 );
35
36 std::copy(data.begin(), data.end(), bytes());
37
38 return *this;
39 }
40
41
42 VideoOutputFrame& VideoOutputFrame::load(const unsigned char *data_start, size_t data_size) {
43 if (!data_start)
44 BOOST_THROW_EXCEPTION(null_pointer_error() << errmsg("`data_start` cannot be null"));
45
46 if (data_size != size())
47 BOOST_THROW_EXCEPTION(size_error()
48 << errmsg("VideoOutputFrame buffer and provided buffer sizes do not match")
49 << actual_size(data_size)
50 << expected_size(size())
51 );
52
53 std::copy(data_start, data_start + data_size, bytes());
54
55 return *this;
56 }
57}
